item.title: Arati Prabhakar
item.description: Aratiâ€™s career has spanned multiple leadership roles as a public servant and in Silicon Valley, with the common thread of advancing research and technology to achieve societal and business impact. She was director of DARPA 2012-17 and director of NIST 1993-97.

item.title: Carolyn Shaw
item.description: Carolyn worked with program managers and the leaders at DARPA 2013-18 to make things happen. While getting her MBA she reunited with Arati and Wade to start Actuate.

item.title: DataSafes
item.description: The problem Valuable insights from administrative, educational, and health data are inaccesible due to privacy concerns ## The opportunity Research in secure computation, differential privacy, and automated linking & model generation opens the way to a new approach ## DataSafes Research and demonstrate statistical modeling and machine learning across multiple datasets with rigorous privacy protection ## The future Myriad datasets safely available to inform robust research, experimentation, and policymaking for better education, health, and public services

item.title: MACA
item.description: Promising new approaches to mitigate and adapt to climate change are emerging today from laboratories and startups. But on their current course, most will take too many decades to achieve the scale of adoption necessary to make a meaningful contribution to our urgent climate challenges.

item.title: Scalable Prevention of Chronic Disease
item.description: The Scalable Prevention of Chronic Disease program takes aim at one of the most expensive and rapidly growing areas of U.S. healthcare: chronic disease. Despite a degree of progress with wellness and coaching programs, fewer than one percent of the 84 million Americans at risk of diabetes are pursuing the healthy habits that are proven to prevent the disease.

item.title: Wade Shen
item.description: Wade is a data science and artificial intelligence expert who has funded and worked with researchers in universities and companies, users in governments and in companies, and policy makers to create and demonstrate solutions to thorny problems.
